trans-unit.source: Applied to a Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) service to indicate whether that service can be run in ASP.NET compatibility code.

When applied to a service implementation class, this attribute indicates whether this service requires or supports [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] compatibility mode to be enabled for the hosting application domain (AppDomain).
AppDomains hosting [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] services can run in two different hosting modes:
Mixed Transports Mode (Default): In this mode, [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] services do not participate in the [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] HTTP pipeline.
This guarantees that a [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] service behaves consistently, independent of hosting environment and transport.

[!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] Compatibility Mode: In this mode, [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] services participate in the [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] HTTP pipeline in a manner similar to ASMX services.

[!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] features such as File Authorization, UrlAuthorization, and HTTP Session State are applicable to [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] services running in this mode.
The hosting mode is controlled by the application-level configuration flag `aspNetCompatibilityEnabled`.

This flag is `false` by default and thus [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] services run in the Mixed Transports Mode unless you explicitly opt into the [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] compatibility mode.

[!INCLUDE[crabout](~/includes/crabout-md.md)] [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] compatibility mode, see [\<serviceHostingEnvironment\>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/wcf/servicehostingenvironment.md).
Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activation.AspNetCompatibilityRequirementsAttribute.RequirementsMode%2A> property to do this.

At runtime, applications can detect if [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] compatibility mode is enabled by checking the value of the static property <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostingEnvironment.AspNetCompatibilityEnabled%2A>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Activation.AspNetCompatibilityRequirementsAttribute"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the level of [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] compatibility required by the service.
Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activation.AspNetCompatibilityRequirementsAttribute.RequirementsMode%2A> property to set the hosting mode in code.
This can also be done by setting an application-level configuration flag `aspNetCompatibilityEnabled`.
[!INCLUDE[crdefault](~/includes/crdefault-md.md)][\<serviceHostingEnvironment\>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/wcf/servicehostingenvironment.md).

At runtime, applications can detect whether [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] compatibility mode is enabled by checking the value of the static property <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostingEnvironment.AspNetCompatibilityEnabled%2A>.

The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Activation.AspNetCompatibilityRequirementsMode"></xref> that indicates the services required degree of [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] compatibility.
The default value is <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Activation.AspNetCompatibilityRequirementsMode.Allowed"></xref>.
The value is not a valid one for the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Activation.AspNetCompatibilityRequirementsMode"></xref>`enum`.
Adds custom data that the binding elements can access to support the implementation of the contract.
This method supports the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription"></xref> of the service.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase"></xref> used to host the service.
The <xref href="System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint"></xref> that contains the endpoints for the service.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingParameterCollection"></xref> that contains the parameters that the binding elements for the service can access.
Checks that the type of hosting is consistent with the [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] compatibility requirements.
This method supports the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription"></xref> of the service.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase"></xref> for hosting the service.
description is `null`.
The service hosting is not compatible with the [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] compatibility requirements.
Validates the service behavior.
This method supports the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription"></xref> of the service.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase"></xref> for hosting the service.
